meanings.definition: To vary in conjunction with something else.
meanings.sent1: The number of sunny days covaries with the amount of ice cream sold.
meanings.sent2: Her mood covaries with the weather outside.
meanings.sent3: The cat's nap schedule covaries with the owner's work hours.
meanings.sent4: The growth of plants covaries with the amount of sunlight they receive.
meanings.sent5: The success of the team covaries with the effort put in by each member.

meanings.definition: To have a close relationship or correlation with another variable.
meanings.sent1: His weight covaries with his exercise routine.
meanings.sent2: The stock prices covary with the company's performance.
meanings.sent3: The dog's energy level covaries with the length of the walk.
meanings.sent4: The student's grades covary with the amount of time spent studying.
meanings.sent5: The quality of the product covaries with the attention to detail in its production.
